Lost Conference }} The '''[[1989 NFL season|1989]] [[St. Louis Rams|Los Angeles Rams]] season''' was the team's 52nd year with the [[National Football League]] and the 44th season in [[Los Angeles]]. ==Offseason== ===NFL Draft=== {{main|1989 NFL Draft}} {| class="wikitable sortable sortable" ! style="background:#14345B;color:#ffc322;" width="7%"| Round ! style="background:#14345B;color:#ffc322;" width="7%"| Pick ! style="background:#14345B;color:#ffc322;" width="20%"| Player ! style="background:#14345B;color:#ffc322;" width="15%"| Position ! style="background:#14345B;color:#ffc322;" width="20%"| School/Club Team |- |} ==Regular season== In week 16, Jerry Gray returned an interception 27 yards for a touchdown. The victory over the New England Patriots clinched a playoff berth for the Rams. ===Schedule=== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style="background:#14345B;color:#ffc322;" | '''Game''' || '''Date''' || '''Opponent''' || '''Result''' || '''Rams points''' || '''Opponents''' || '''Rams first downs''' || '''Record''' || '''Attendance''' |- align="center" bgcolor="ddffdd" | 1 ||Sept. 10 || at [[Atlanta Falcons]] || Win || 31 || 21 || 21 || 1-0 ||

|- align="center" bgcolor="" |}http://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/ram/1989.htm ===Standings=== {{1989 NFC West standings}} ==Playoffs== ===NFC Wild Card Game=== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle=text-align:center; {{NFLPrimaryStyle|Los Angeles Rams 73thru94}} |title=Los Angeles Rams 21, Philadelphia Eagles 7 |Road='''Rams''' |R1=14 |R2=0 |R3=0 |R4=7 |RT=21 |Home=Eagles |H1=0 |H2=0 |H3=0 |H4=7 |HT=7 |stadium= [[Veterans Stadium]], [[Philadelphia]] |time= 12:30 p.m. [[North American Eastern Standard Time Zone|EST]] |TV=[[NFL on CBS|CBS]] |TVAnnouncers= [[Pat Summerall]] and [[John Madden (football)|John Madden]] |referee= [[Gordon McCarter]] |attendance= 65,479 }} ===NFC Divisional Playoff=== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle=text-align:center; {{NFLPrimaryStyle|Los Angeles Rams 73thru94}} |title=Los Angeles Rams 19, New York Giants 13 (OT) |Road='''Rams''' |R1=0 |R2=7 |R3=0 |R4=6 |R5=6 |RT=19 |Home=Giants |H1=6 |H2=0 |H3=7 |H4=0 |H5=0 |HT=13 |stadium= [[Giants Stadium]], [[East Rutherford, New Jersey]] |time= 12:30 p.m. [[North American Eastern Standard Time Zone|EST]] |TV=[[NFL on CBS|CBS]] |TVAnnouncers= [[Pat Summerall]] and [[John Madden (American football)|John Madden]] |referee= [[Bob McElwee]] |attendance= 76,325 }} The Rams upset the Giants with quarterback Jim Everett's 30-yard touchdown pass to [[Flipper Anderson]] with 1:06 gone in overtime. New York jumped to a 6-0 lead in the first quarter with two field goals by kicker Raul Allegre. With 17 seconds left in the first half, Anderson caught a 20-yard touchdown reception from Everett to take a 7-6 lead. In the third quarter, Giants running back [[Ottis Anderson]] scored on a 2-yard touchdown. But in the fourth period, Los Angeles kicker Mike Lansford made two field goals to tie the game, the second one coming with 3:01 left in regulation. Rams receiver [[Henry Ellard]] had the best postseason performance of his career with 8 receptions for 125 yards. ===NFC Championship Game=== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle=text-align:center; {{NFLPrimaryStyle|Los Angeles Rams 73thru94}} |title=San Francisco 49ers 30, Los Angeles Rams 3 |Road=Rams |R1=3 |R2=0 |R3=0 |R4=0 |RT=3 |Home='''49ers''' |H1=0 |H2=21 |H3=3 |H4=6 |HT=30 |stadium= [[Candlestick Park]], [[San Francisco]] |time= 5:00 p.m. [[North American Eastern Standard Time Zone|EST]]/2:00 p.m. [[Pacific Standard Time Zone|PST]] |TV=[[NFL on CBS|CBS]] |TVAnnouncers= [[Pat Summerall]] and [[John Madden (football)|John Madden]] |referee= [[Jerry Markbreit]] |attendance= 64,769 }} The 49ers crushed the Rams with 442 total yards and held the ball for 39:48. ==Awards and records== *Flipper Anderson, NFL Game Record, Most Receiving Yards in One Game, 336 yards (vs. New Orleans Saints on November 26, 1989) NFL 2001 Record and Fact Book, Workman Publishing Co, New York,NY, ISBN 0-7611-2480-2, p. 98 * Jerry Gray, NFC Pro Bowl Selection * Jerry Gray, Pro Bowl MVP ===Milestones=== ==See also== ;Other Anaheimâbased teams in 1989]] * '''[[Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim|California Angels]]''' ''([[Angel Stadium of Anaheim|Anaheim Stadium]])'' ** [[1989 California Angels season]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/ram/1989.htm 1989 Los Angeles Rams Season at Pro-Football Reference] {{Los Angeles Rams}} {{1989 NFL season by team}} {{DEFAULTSORT:1989 Los Angeles Rams Season}} [[Category:1989 National Football League season by team|Los Angeles Rams]] [[Category:Los Angeles Rams seasons]]
